item.title: Node :: Usage nvm
item.description: Usage NVM To download, compile, and install the latest release of node, do this: nvm install node # "node" is an alias for the latest version To install a specific version of node: nvm install 6.14.4 # or 10.10.0, 8.9.1, etc The first version installed becomes the default. New shells will start with the default version of node (e.g., nvm alias default). You can list available versions using ls-remote: nvm ls-remote And then in any new shell just use the installed version:
